hero.name: Günther Cwioro
hero.title: Full-Stack Software Engineer
hero.tagline: I build robust, scalable software solutions with over 10 years of experience in .NET, Vue 3, and cloud architectures.

about.title: About Me
about.p1: Since my early age, I am interested in computers and always wanted to understand how computers work. In middle school, I got an old Java programming book from a relative of my friend and I started reading it. Shortly thereafter, my first computer program was written and compiled.
about.p2: Since that moment I am passionate about programming and enjoy it. Besides my love for coding, I am a very open-minded person, who always tries to see the sunny sides in life. I am very loyal and love to work with team members to tackle targets together.
about.p3: I am passionate about learning new things or trying out something new, such as new programming languages, frameworks, or a sport I have never done before.

backend.title: Backend Development
backend.description: Robust APIs and microservices with .NET/C#, Node.js and Domain-Driven Design. Focus on clean architecture and maintainable code.

frontend.title: Frontend Development
frontend.description: Modern, reactive web applications with Vue 3 and TypeScript. Responsive design and optimal user experience.

architecture.title: System Architecture
architecture.description: Scalable cloud architectures on GCP. Microservices design, container orchestration with Kubernetes and Docker.

consulting.title: Technical Consulting
consulting.description: Code reviews, architecture audits and technical consulting. Support for implementing DDD and best practices.

freelance.title: Freelance Software Engineer
freelance.description: Started my freelance career to have more flexibility while building my own startup. Working with various clients on backend development and API design.

autoletter.title: Founder
autoletter.description: Founded my own startup focused on automated letter generation and delivery services.

timetoact.title: Senior Full-Stack Developer
timetoact.description: Continuation of my role after Trustbit was acquired by TimeToAct Group Austria. Working part-time as Senior Full-Stack Developer while pursuing my own ventures.

trustbit.title: Senior Full-Stack Developer
trustbit.description: Senior Full-Stack Developer with focus on C#, .NET and Vue 3 (TypeScript). Deeply engaged with Domain-Driven Design (DDD) methodology. Attended DDD Europe (Amsterdam) and Kandddinsky (Berlin) conferences.

kickscale.title: Lead Developer
kickscale.description: Lead-Developer of Kickscale's SaaS platform. React and Node.js, Firebase, Cloud Functions, Github Actions.

hex.title: Software Engineer
hex.description: Development of cloud-based software solutions for optimization. Tasks ranged from backend design and development to implementation of optimization algorithms. Responsible for deployment, monitoring and maintenance on Google Cloud Platform.

adhoc.title: AD-HOC WLAN Routing Protocol
adhoc.description: Award-winning research project: Development of a reliable multi-cast routing protocol on Layer 2 for robot swarms.
adhoc.fullDescription: During my time at technical high school, I developed an AD-HOC WLAN routing protocol on Layer 2 in C++ as part of my thesis. The project was conducted at the Institute for Networked and Embedded Systems at Alpen-Adria University Klagenfurt. The goal was to implement a reliable multi-cast routing protocol for autonomous robots, enabling decentralized communication without central infrastructure.

highlights.0: Implementation of a complete Layer-2 AD-HOC network stack in C++
highlights.1: Integration into the Robot Operating System (ROS) for robot swarms
highlights.2: Published as open-source project with scientific publication
highlights.3: Decentralized communication without central network infrastructure

jugendinnovativ.title: 1st Place Jugendinnovativ 2014
jugendinnovativ.description: Winner of the Austrian Youth Innovation Competition in the 'Engineering' category. The most prestigious competition for innovative student projects in Austria.

isef.title: Intel ISEF Participation
isef.description: Represented Austria at the Intel International Science and Engineering Fair (ISEF) in Los Angeles – the world's largest international science competition for high school students.

autoletter.title: Autoletter.at
autoletter.description: Own startup for automated letter generation and delivery services. Full-stack development from idea to product.
autoletter.fullDescription: Autoletter.at is my own startup, which I founded in 2024. The platform automates the entire process of letter creation and delivery. Customers can create letters via an API or web interface, which are then automatically printed, enveloped, and sent via postal service.

highlights.0: Complete full-stack development from concept to production
highlights.1: API-first design for easy integration into existing systems
highlights.2: Automated print preparation and shipping processing

noborder.title: No Border Dashboard
noborder.description: Dashboard for order tracking and investigation, enabling clients to monitor their shipments in real-time.
noborder.fullDescription: For the fulfillment startup No Border, I developed a comprehensive dashboard for order tracking. The platform enables customers to track their shipments in real-time and quickly identify causes when problems occur. Additionally, API interfaces were implemented for integration with the fulfillment platform.

highlights.0: Real-time shipment tracking with live updates
highlights.1: Comprehensive API interfaces for customer integration
highlights.2: Investigative tools for quick problem identification

trustbit.title: DDD Enterprise Projects
trustbit.description: Development of complex enterprise applications with Domain-Driven Design, Event Sourcing and CQRS.
trustbit.fullDescription: At Trustbit and later TimeToAct Group Austria, I worked on several enterprise projects with a focus on Domain-Driven Design. The projects involved complex business logic implemented using Event Sourcing and CQRS patterns. I attended the DDD Europe (Amsterdam) and Kandddinsky (Berlin) conferences.

highlights.0: Implementation of complex domain models with DDD patterns
highlights.1: Event Sourcing for complete audit trails and reproducibility
highlights.2: CQRS architecture for optimal read and write operations

kickscale.title: Kickscale SaaS
kickscale.description: Lead development of a SaaS platform for sales teams. React frontend with Firebase backend.
kickscale.fullDescription: As Lead Developer at Kickscale, I was responsible for developing the entire SaaS platform. The application supports sales teams in managing their customer relationships and automates recurring tasks. The architecture is based on React in the frontend and Firebase in the backend with Cloud Functions for serverless logic.

highlights.0: Technical leadership of the entire development team
highlights.1: Serverless architecture with Firebase and Cloud Functions
highlights.2: CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions for automated deployments

saraas.title: SaRaaS - Scheduling & Routing as a Service
saraas.description: Build! founders program project: Developing customized optimization solutions for scheduling and routing problems.
saraas.fullDescription: As part of the Build! founders program at Alpen-Adria-Universität Klagenfurt, I co-founded a project developing a Scheduling and Routing as a Service platform. We designed foundational algorithms for scheduling and routing optimization problems with emphasis on performance efficiency. The platform delivers solutions within seconds of processing time, crucial for real-world applications.

highlights.1: Co-authored academic paper published on arXiv
highlights.2: Collaboration with the Institute for Mathematics

satalia.title: Vehicle Routing Optimization
satalia.description: Development of optimization libraries for the Vehicle Routing Problem (VRP) for large-scale clients.
satalia.fullDescription: At Satalia NPCOMPLETE, I was part of the backend optimization team. We developed optimization libraries in Java 8 for large clients in the logistics industry. My main responsibility was implementing optimization methods and heuristics for specialized sub-problems of the Vehicle Routing Problem (VRP).

highlights.0: Implementation of heuristics for the Vehicle Routing Problem
highlights.1: Route optimization to maximize capacity utilization
highlights.2: Strict code quality – bugs would have cost millions

bitmoving.title: Cloud Video Encoding
bitmoving.description: Development of a distributed cloud video encoding service for MPEG-DASH and HLS content.
bitmoving.fullDescription: At Bitmoving, I worked on a distributed cloud video encoding service. The system converted videos into MPEG-DASH and HLS formats for streaming applications. I started as a junior C++ developer and evolved into a polyglot developer with experience in Java, PHP, and Python.

highlights.0: Distributed video encoding pipeline in the cloud
highlights.1: Support for MPEG-DASH and HLS streaming formats
highlights.2: Development in multiple languages: C++, Java, PHP, Python

optimization.title: Cloud Optimization (Hex)
optimization.description: Cloud-based optimization solutions on GCP. Microservices architecture for scalability.
optimization.fullDescription: At Hex GmbH, I developed cloud-based software solutions for optimization problems. Tasks ranged from designing and developing backend services to implementing optimization algorithms and heuristics. I was responsible for deployment, monitoring, and maintenance on Google Cloud Platform.

highlights.0: Microservices architecture on Google Cloud Platform
highlights.1: Implementation of optimization algorithms and heuristics

contact.title: Contact
contact.subtitle: Let's work together
contact.description: Have a project in mind or just want to say hello? I'd love to hear from you.
